channel.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
channel.description:
What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
Currently I use ReSlice to chop up loops, which is particularly good to get around the 10 second limit that is imposed.

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Just a quick heads up, you cannot import anything into ReSlice without AudioShare, it’s literally the only way. But AudioShare is great so it’s totally worth it.

Same dev who makes Aum as Blakkaz mentioned.

EDIT: Pete and I were talking about it on another thread, anyone remember ReCycle??? It’s basically like getting the core function of Propellerheads ReCycle for a minuscule fraction of the price!

Read full topic

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Stumbled on this recently. Might grab it myself.
Looks like a good iOS option for chopping and trimming samples, transients, etc…

App Store

‎ReSlice

‎Audio Slice Machine Slice your audio samples with ReSlice and create flexible musical atoms which can be triggered by MIDI notes or the touch of your fingers. The polyrhythm Arpeggiator redefines the art of creating new loops from the extracted...

https://www.youtube.com/embed/j2YCv0wEQ2A

item.source: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
For chopping loops, I’ve just used garageband. But to be honest, now if I need to add things like samples that are a pain to deal with or a special effect I need to hands-on handle, I’ll do it post-auxy production when I do the mastering work in FL studio.

As for editing stuff, I use audacity because edison has given me issues in the past working natively in FL Studio.

Read full topic
item.source: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: DontPartyWithGuns
item.description:
When mastering I use GarageBand and then make the masters louder with Audacity as they tend to render quiet.

Read full topic
item.source: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
I just discovered that FL Studio now has a MAC version. Can download it for free to play around with, just can’t open any saved files on the trial version. Good way to check it out.

Have used Audacity for cutting up drum loops for D’n’B. Not the most intuitive app, but does the job.

I’ve put some tracks through https://www.bandlab.com for mastering.

Also put a couple of tracks into Garageband (OSX) to add samples, prior to the sample functionality being added to Auxy.

Read full topic

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
I actually use Auxy to “enhance” my tracks.

My main software is Ableton Live 10.
But, when I’m not in the studio, with my gear, I use Auxy, Groovebox, Seaboard 5D, NOISE, and triqtraq. Then after I go through all those apps, I bounce all the audio into Live.

Read full topic

item.source: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
Here’s what I use (most of these are for sampling):

  • Voice Recorder & Audio Editor
    by TapMedia Ltd
    Record audio, which can then be cut and sampled into Auxy.
    Price: Free.
    In-App Purchases: Yes. But unneeded.

  • The File Converter
    by SmoothMobile, LLC
    Convert almost any file type, with more options than you can imagine. This works well in conjunction with other apps on this list that don’t convert directly to WAV.
    Price: $2.99 (I think).

  • Song Cutter
    by Evan Hurst
    Chop up samples. Not much more to be said.
    Price: Free.
    In-App Purchases: Slightly mandatory. You can only chop 1 piece every 30 minutes.

  • Documents by Readdle
    by Readdle Inc
    This is how you download files online. You can use this app to download sample packs, or download a YouTube video.
    Price: Free (I think).
    In-App Purchases: Probably, but I’ve never came across them.

Apple apps that I use:

  • Files
    Storage for all of your projects.

  • Voice Memos
    Every time you have a song idea, cringely record your beatbox version, to store the idea for future use.

Websites I use:

  • tempotap.com
    for mobile and desktop
    Let’s you quickly tap a tempo to find out what BPM to use for your idea.

Read full topic

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
I think Aum is the perfect companion to Auxy.
It supports Audio Units as well as having the following built-in:

DSP List (click for more details)

Perfect for putting the finishing touches on your tracks.

item.title: What other apps do you use to enhance your tracks?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Audacity/Ocenaudio for trimming, repitching and extending (via the PaulStretch plugin).

Grand Finale (Klevgr) or BandLab.com for manual and automated mastering respectively.
